key.name: first-start
key.summary: An internal key that must not be changed manually
key.description: Whether this is the first start of the extension or not. It is used to display a welcome message and/or open preferences.

key.name: enable-opening-animation
key.description: Whether to enable or disable the opening animation.

key.name: enable-closing-animation
key.description: Whether to enable or disable the closing animation.

key.name: transparent-terminal
key.description: Whether to enable terminal transparency (true) or keep the terminal opaque (false).

key.name: scrollbar-visible
key.description: Whether the terminal scrollbar is visible (true) or hidden (false).

key.name: terminal-height
key.description: The terminal window height in pixels (400px for instance) or in percentage (30% for instance).

key.name: shortcut-type
key.description: The type of shortcut used to open and close the terminal. If 'other' is set, the definition must be set in the 'other-shortcut' key.

key.name: other-shortcut
key.summary: The manual shortcut used to toggle the terminal
key.description: The shortcut used to open and close the terminal if shortcut-type is 'other'.

key.name: real-shortcut
key.summary: An internal key that must not be changed manually
key.description: 'Above_Tab' is displayed as 'Disabled' in a GtkCellRendererAccel and that really looks bad. This is why there is this special key which is the final, real shortcut used, and which is not displayed in the preferences UI.

key.name: run-custom-command
key.summary: Whether to run a custom command or the default
key.description: Whether to use the custom command set in the 'custom-command' key or not (the user shell is used instead).

key.name: custom-command
key.description: The custom command to launch in the terminal, only used if the 'run-custom-command' key value is 'true'.
